thread.title: Jones, Sharks beat Devils in shootout to remain unbeaten
thread.title_full: Jones, Sharks beat Devils in shootout to remain unbeaten

author: TOM CANAVAN
title: Jones, Sharks beat Devils in shootout to remain unbeaten
text:
1 of 4 Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils right wing Stephen Gionta (11) trips over San Jose Sharks goalie Martin Jones during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. A goal by the Devils was disallowed during the play. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils left wing Mike Cammalleri, right, skates against San Jose Sharks center Joe Pavelski during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils goalie Cory Schneider makes a save against the San Jose Sharks during the first period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils goalie Cory Schneider, right, stops a penalty shot by San Jose Sharks center Patrick Marleau during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) AP Jones, Sharks beat Devils in shootout to remain unbeaten By TOM CANAVAN 0 Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils right wing Stephen Gionta (11) trips over San Jose Sharks goalie Martin Jones during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. A goal by the Devils was disallowed during the play. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils left wing Mike Cammalleri, right, skates against San Jose Sharks center Joe Pavelski during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils goalie Cory Schneider makes a save against the San Jose Sharks during the first period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) Julio Cortez 
New Jersey Devils goalie Cory Schneider, right, stops a penalty shot by San Jose Sharks center Patrick Marleau during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Newark, N.J. (AP Photo/Julio Cortez) 
NEWARK, N.J. (AP) — Joe Pavelski and Brent Burns scored in the shootout and the San Jose Sharks rode another big effort by goaltender Martin Jones in posting a 2-1 victory over the winless New Jersey Devils on Friday night. 
Jones stopped 31 shots and came within 3:38 of posting his third straight shutout as the Sharks posted their fourth straight win under former New Jersey coach Pete DeBoer. They also kept the Devils winless at 0-3-1 under new coach John Hynes. 
DeBoer, who was fired by the Devils last season, is now 4-0 with San Jose. 
Patrick Marleau scored for the Sharks in the opening minute and the goal stood until Adam Henrique tied the game on a power play with 3:38 to play in regulation. 
Henrique scored for New Jersey on its first shootout attempt but Jacob Josefson was stopped on the second and Mike Cammalleri missed the net on the third. ×
